snippet: As homemade electricity gains popularity, it puts new pressures on old infrastructure and cuts into electric company revenue, pitting solar companies against utilities.
abstract: Dispute between Hawaiian Electric Company and homeowners who wish to install solar panel rooftop system illustrates way electric utilities are struggling with growing popularity of making electricity at home; home systems put new pressures on circuits and power lines and also cut into electric company revenue, which has prompted companies to stem rise of solar in variety of ways.
lead_paragraph: As homemade electricity gains popularity, it puts new pressures on old infrastructure and cuts into electric company revenue, pitting solar companies against utilities.

headline.main: Solar Power Battle Puts Hawaii at Forefront of Worldwide Changes
headline.print_headline: Utilities See Solar Panels as Threat to Bottom Line
